column4: Washington is limited in its response to North Korea over Sony hack

column5: LOS ANGELES Sony Pictures said on Friday it is looking for alternatives to release "The Interview" after it scrapped the Christmas Day theatrical opening of the screwball comedy at the center of a cyber attack on the studio blamed on North Korea.

column5: WASHINGTON President Barack Obama on Friday said he would ban exports of goods  technology or services to Ukraine's Crimea region  and called on Russia to end its annexation of the region.

column4: Risk modelers look to clarify cyber risk costs
column5: NEW YORK Even as the Sony Corp cyber attack laid bare the kinds of vulnerabilities that typically drive companies to buy insurance policies  the lack of a risk model for insurers means such protection is not always easy to get.

column4: Obama says Sony 'made a mistake' in pulling 'The Interview'
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. President Barack Obama on Friday said Sony Pictures "made a mistake" in pulling the satirical film "The Interview" after suffering a devastating cyber attack blamed on North Korea. "I wish they (Sony) would have spoken to me first " Obama said at a news conference. "I would have told them  'Do not get into a pattern in which you're intimidated by these kinds of criminal attacks.'"
